resources.string:
Ping:
 Ping is a computer network administration software utility used to test the reachability of a host on an Internet Protocol (IP) network. It is available for virtually all operating systems that have networking capability, including most embedded network administration software. Ping measures the round-trip-time for messages sent from the originating host to a destination computer that are echoed back to the source. The round-trip-time is the sum of the time taken by the data to travel from the source to the destination and from the destination to the source. 
 
 Wi-Fi strength:
 The Wi-Fi strength is the power of the received Wi-Fi wave from your phone. This four-level (from 0 to 3) indicator is also represented on the top of your screen (the Wi-Fi indicator). This parameter is important: the weaker the signal is, the more you could loose receiving/sending data. 
 
 Proportion of lost packets:
 This parameter shows the percentage of data packets that have been lost during the tests. Even if this is not a precious test, it can show the empirical probability of lost data packets during your utilisation of the network.
